content:
On its face, this ordinance
was supposed simply to prevent fires. In practice, however, the Board of



408
CHAPTER 18 ■Legal Reasoning
Supervisors granted permits to all but one of the non-Chinese applicants
and denied permits to all the Chinese applicants. Because of this practice,
Yick Wo claimed that the ordinance violated the equal protection clause. The
Supreme Court agreed and declared the ordinance unconstitutional, at least
insofar as it gave the city power to grant and refuse permits “
